programme.desc: Includes live performances from Tim McGraw and Faith Hill's 2017 Soul2Soul world tour, as well as an intimate look inside their relationship. Never before seen interviews are presented along side behind-the-scenes footage, capturing their chemistry on and off the stage. Directed and executive produced by the award-winning team of Dan Cutforth and Jane Lipsitz.

programme.title: Whitney. "Can I Be Me"
programme.desc: Directors Nick Broomfield and Rudi Dolezal weave never before seen video, candid interviews and behind the scenes performance footage into a raw and uncensored portrait of Whitney Houston, who died suddenly at age 48 after years of struggling with addiction. Exploring her far-reaching impact, the directors focus on Houston's central dilemma: even though she had made millions of dollars and was recognized as having one of the greatest voices of all time, she still couldn't do what she wanted, either professionally or in her personal life.(c)

programme.title: George Michael: Freedom
programme.desc: Documentary covering the span of his career, but concentrating on the formative period in the late Grammy Award winner's life, leading up to and following the making of his acclaimed album 'Listen Without Prejudice Vol. 1' and the subsequent High Court battle with his record label that followed, while also becoming poignantly personal about the death of his late partner and first love, Anselmo Feleppa. Filmed before Michael's untimely passing, the film is narrated by him, who was heavily involved in the making of it.

programme.title: Prince: Sign 'o' the Times
programme.desc: This concert film features clips of live stage performances from Rotterdam and Minnesota, and is also interspersed with short films from the artist. Fan favorites, such as 'Little Red Corvette' and 'U Got the Look,' are performed as Prince is accompanied on stage by Sheena Easton and drummer Sheila E.

programme.title: Dogville
programme.desc: Provocative and emotionally demanding, Lars von Trier's controversial allegory about the darker side of human nature and American arrogance has been likened to a hellish version of "Our Town." Into a small town - represented by chalk outlines and a few props - arrives a stranger (Nicole Kidman) in need of sanctuary. Initially welcoming, Dogville's citizens show their true colors once they listen to their paranoiac fears. This winner of more than 10 international awards costars Paul Bettany, James Caan, Patricia Clarkson and Lauren Bacall.

programme.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe
programme.desc: Coroner Tommy Tilden and son Austin run a morgue and crematorium in Virginia. When the local sheriff brings in a body found in the basement of a home, it seems like just another open-and-shut case. As the autopsy proceeds however, they are left reeling as the inspection brings new revelations. Perfectly preserved on the outside, Jane Doe seems to have been the victim of a horrific ritualistic torture. Tommy and Austin begin to piece together these gruesome discoveries, as an unnatural force takes hold of the crematorium.

programme.title: Cursed to Kill
programme.desc: Rachel awakens in a hospital, paralyzed from the waist down after a failed attempt on her life for abandoning a cult suicide. Her suffering grows as the spirits of the deceased members begin to haunt her within the confines of the hospital room. They threaten to kill her unless she is willing to offer up a kindred soul in place of her own - her brother's child. But the week that Rachel is given to make her decision is tethered to a curse. All who have the misfortune of hearing anything she says are met with a swift and violent death.

programme.title: Behold the Monkey
programme.desc: A well-intentioned pensioner restores a fresco in a small Spanish town.

programme.title: Queen of the Desert
programme.desc: Gertrude Bell (Nicole Kidman) rejects the stifling rigidity of life in turn-of-the-century England, leaving it behind for a chance to travel to Tehran. She begins her lifelong adventure across the Arab world, a journey marked by danger, a passionate affair with a British officer (James Franco), and an encounter with the legendary T.E. Lawrence (Robert Pattinson).

programme.title: The Full F**K You Finger
programme.desc: The stress of juggling school and Charmaine's baby shower causes Tara to transition, with negative consequences for Charmaine; to sell the family business, Max must get the approval of his eccentric mother (guest star Frances Conroy); Kate meets a flight attendant who inspires a new idea about her future.(c)

programme.title: Wheels
programme.desc: Tara and Charmaine are rushed to the hospital in the same ambulance, where Charmaine declares her baby off limits to her crazy sister; Tara attempts to make a deal with her alters, which intrigues her Abnormal Psychology professor; Marshall, Lionel and Noah put Charmaine's empty house to some creative uses; Kate is embarrassed to confess that she backed out of going to Japan.(c)

programme.title: It Stains The Sands Red
programme.desc: In the throes of a zombie apocalypse, Molly - a troubled woman from Las Vegas with a dark past - finds herself stranded in the desert with a ravenous zombie on her tail. At first, she's easily able to outpace her undead pursuer, but things quickly become worse when she realizes the zombie doesn't need to ever stop and rest. Running low on supplies and beat down by the harsh environment, Molly must summon strength she never knew she had in order to face it.

programme.title: You, Me and Him
programme.desc: Two female lovers, one a career driven lawyer (Lucy Punch), the other a fun-loving, pot-smoking layabout (Faye Marsay), have an annoying Casanova neighbor (David Tennant). While neither woman ever wanted children, both end up pregnant, creating conflicts that cause each to re-examine their outlook on life and their relationship.

programme.title: Bad Grandmas
programme.desc: Senior citizens Mimi, Bobbi, Virginia and Coralee quietly live out their twilight years in Southern Missouri playing cards and baking cakes. Bobbi's son-in-law, Jim, cons her into losing her house and Mimi, the unofficial leader of the group, decides to take matters into her own hands. Things spin out of control when she confronts Jim and he accidentally gets killed in the altercation.

Diagnosed with spinal cancer, 27 year old Adam (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) navigates the road to recovery with the sometimes-overbearing support of his crude best friend, Kyle (Seth Rogen), his smothering mother (Anjelica Huston) and an inexperienced therapist (Anna Kendrick). Inspired by a true story, 50/50 is an honest yet hysterically funny account of a young man's journey toward healing.

programme.title: Queen of the Desert
programme.desc: Gertrude Bell (Nicole Kidman) rejects the stifling rigidity of life in turn-of-the-century England, leaving it behind for a chance to travel to Tehran. She begins her lifelong adventure across the Arab world, a journey marked by danger, a passionate affair with a British officer (James Franco), and an encounter with the legendary T.E. Lawrence (Robert Pattinson).(n)

programme.title: Vicky Cristina Barcelona
programme.desc: Romantic comedy-drama about a pair of American friends (Scarlett Johansson and Rebecca Hall) who vacation together in Spain and fall under the romantic spell of Juan, a passionate artist (Javier Bardem).(n)

programme.title: The Funhouse Massacre
programme.desc: On Halloween night, a group of notorious serial killers escape from an asylum and terrorize the patrons of a funhouse carnival - leaving only a rag-tag bunch of kids, a clueless deputy and a local sheriff to stop the carnage.(n)

programme.title: Fight Valley
programme.desc: When a young woman is found dead after getting involved in an underground fighting ring, her sister begins training under a respected ex-fighter to bring justice to the killer.(n)

programme.title: Kelly's Hollywood
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling the intimate story of an aspiring actor who brings his sister, born with Down syndrome, out to Los Angeles to pursue her dream of becoming a Hollywood diva. But as her health begins to fail and she becomes increasing jealous of his fiancée, he is forced to confront his co-dependent sibling relationship and the threat it is posing to his engagement.(n)

programme.title: Sleepless
programme.desc: When Las Vegas cop Vincent Downs (Jamie Foxx) and his partner Sean (Tip "T.I." Harris) rob a cocaine shipment bound for a drug-dealing casino boss (Dermot Mulroney), the desperate businessman retaliates by kidnapping Vincent's son (Octavius J. Johnson). Pursued by a dogged Internal Affairs investigator (Michelle Monaghan) and a sadistic drug kingpin (Scoot McNairy), Vincent must rely on his street smarts and sheer force of will as he tries to rescue his child over the course of a single night. Directed by Baran bo Odar.(n)

programme.title: Fair Haven
programme.desc: A young piano prodigy returns to his family farm, after a long stay in a gay conversion therapy, and is torn between the expectations of his emotionally distant father and the memory of a past, loving relationship he's tried to bury.(n)

programme.title: Collide
programme.desc: Casey, a young American backpacker in Germany, falls in love with Juliette, a fellow American traveling through Europe. She is diagnosed with a fatal disease, and Casey decides to steal from German gangster Hagen, in order to pay for the medical treatment which could save Juliette's life. Casey's heist doesn't go as planned and Hagen catches him. He manages to escape Hagen's men, steal one of Hagen's cars, and flee. Pursued across Germany, he races to save his own life and get to Juliette before Hagen's men get to her first.(n)

programme.title: Dr. Hattaras' Miracle Elixir
programme.desc: Tara tries to drop her Abnormal Psychology class but instead receives an intriguing pitch from her instructor, Dr. Hattaras; Charmaine and Neil find parenthood a struggle but still refuse Tara's help; Max finds himself at odds with his boss at his new job; Kate prepares for flight attendant training; Lionel catches Marshall with Noah, jeopardizing their student film project.(n)

programme.title: The Road To Hell Is Paved With Breast Intentions
programme.desc: Tara seems to be making progress with her new contract but Dr. Hattaras discovers something disturbing in a tape from one her therapy sessions; much to the sisters' chagrin, Neil invites Tara and Charmaine's mother to visit her grandchild; Max is unhappy at his new job but can't talk to Tara about it; Kate is surprised when a handsome flyer rebuffs her flirting.(n)

programme.title: Contracted
programme.desc: Samantha (Townsend) is a twenty‐something party girl with little discipline and even less direction. After experiencing a lapse in her relationship with her lover (Stegeman), she's forced to move back in with her overbearing mother (Williams). Things take a turn for the worse when she spends the night with a mysterious man (Barrett), leaving her hung‐over and guilt‐ridden. However, something else is wrong with Samantha and she's infected. Unsure of the disease, she realizes she is the host of something catastrophic.(n)

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.(n)

programme.title: Killshot
programme.desc: An innocent couple that crosses paths with a professional assassin is forced into the witness protection program while the resourceful killer hunts them down in this crime thriller starring Diane Lane, Mickey Rourke and Thomas Jane.(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: A woman emerges from a coma four years after taking a bullet to the head at her own wedding, and goes on an epic vendetta against her former boss and his deadly squad of international assassins in a kill or be-killed fight. Directed by Quentin Tarantino; stars Uma Thurman and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: Glamour for Sale
programme.desc: Minor exposé of crooked escort services that use its “escorts” to prey on unsuspecting males. Anita Louise, Roger Pryor, Frances Robinson. Peggy: June MacCloy. Lucille: Veda Ann Borg. Regan: Don Beddoe. Braddock: Arthur Loft.

programme.title: Shadowed
programme.desc: A businessman (Lloyd Corrigan) encounters danger when he runs into a gang murder while playing golf. Anita Louise, Michael Duane, Robert Scott. Leisurely paced yarn. A good job by Corrigan. John Sturges directed.

programme.title: Judge Priest
programme.desc: In 1890s Kentucky, an unconventional and sympathetic judge presides over town intrigues, including encouraging his nephew to continue his courtship of the girl-next-door despite her shrouded past.

programme.title: Green Light
programme.desc: A selfless young doctor assumes the blame for a senior surgeon's fatal mistake in the operating room.

programme.title: The Go Getter
programme.desc: After losing a leg in the crash of the dirigible Macon, a man (George Brent) tries to succeed as a lumber salesman. Anita Louise. Cappy: Charles Winninger. Skinner: John Eldredge. Tinsdale: Henry O'Neill. Entertaining. Directed by Busby Berkeley.

programme.title: Brides Are Like That
programme.desc: Anita Louise and Ross Alexander are an engaging pair in this trifle about a small-town girl who marries a likable loafer. Joe Cawthorn, Gene Lockhart. Ella: Kathleen Lockhart. Jennie: Mary Lou Treen. Mary: Alma Lloyd. Carter: Craig Reynolds. Jenkins: Dick Purcell. Directed by William McGann.

programme.title: Personal Maid's Secret
programme.desc: Ruth Donnelly gives a fine performance as a lovable domestic who guides the destinies of her employers. Daughter: Anita Louise. Mrs. Smith: Margaret Lindsay. Tom: Warren Hull. Brother: Frank Albertson. Junior: Ronnie Cosby. Butler: Arthur Treacher. Modest but appealing. Arthur Greville Collins directed.

programme.title: Night Song
programme.desc: A brilliant pianist is struck blind. A wealthy woman pretends to be poor and blind to help him regain his confidence, and holds a contest with a large prize for the best musical composition. She, as the blind girl, encourages him to enter it. He wins the prize, uses the money to have his sight restored, falls in love with the wealthy woman, and is thrilled to find that his two loves are one and the same.

programme.title: The North Star
programme.desc: A Russian farming collective endures Nazi atrocities when Germany occupies their village in 1941. When the local children are subjected to involuntary blood donations and medical experiments, resistance begins to grow.

programme.title: Beyond a Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: In order to expose a corrupt DA, a crusading publisher concocts a legal hoax with his future son-in-law to prove the unreliability of circumstantial evidence, with unanticipated complications.

programme.title: While the City Sleeps
programme.desc: When a media mogul dies, his ambivalent son pits three newsmen against each to become his right-hand man, but ambition collides with danger and the competition attracts the attention of a brutal serial killer.

programme.title: Sealed Cargo
programme.desc: A skipper (Dana Andrews) comes across a foundering vessel and finds a deadly secret. Carla Balenda, Claude Rains. Conrad: Philip Dorn. Steve: Skip Homeier. McLean: Onslow Stevens. Well made; suspenseful. Alfred Werker directed.

programme.title: Curse of the Demon
programme.desc: In England, an American professor looks into a devil-worshipping cult that may been responsible for a few recent deaths, but when his investigation hits too close to home, the cult leader slips a cursed parchment into his research files and his life becomes a hell on Earth.

programme.title: The Best Years of Our Lives
programme.desc: Three veterans of WWII have various difficulties readjusting to normal life after returning home from the war. One tries to help get financial help for veterans, another disappoints his wife who expects more from him, and the third negotiates life without hands, having lost them during his service. (cc).

programme.title: The Ox-Bow Incident
programme.desc: William Wellman directed this Western classic about mob violence. Henry Fonda, Dana Andrews, Anthony Quinn, Mary Beth Hughes, William Eythe, Harry Morgan, Jane Darwell. Davies: Harry Davenport. Tyler: Matt Briggs. Tetley: Frank Conroy. Farnley: Marc Lawrence. Darby: Victor Kilian. Mrs. Larch: Margaret Hamilton. Written by Dudley Nichols.

programme.title: Where the Sidewalk Ends
programme.desc: Film-noir drama about a New York City detective with a violent streak who gets involved in the accidental killing of a murder suspect and the subsequent cover-up, which leads to implicating an innocent cab driver.

programme.title: Fallen Angel
programme.desc: A drifter (Dana Andrews) tries to take a small-town woman (Alice Faye) for her money. Complications: a waitress (Linda Darnell) and murder. Charles Bickford, Bruce Cabot, Anne Revere, John Carradine, Percy Kilbride, Olin Howlin. Often absorbing Otto Preminger film, despite some dramatic lapses. Well acted.

programme.title: A Walk in the Sun
programme.desc: In World War II Italy, a sergeant assumes command of his platoon after a series of deaths, and as they prepare to attack an isolated Nazi-held farmhouse, each of the infantrymen reveals his true character as he dwells upon his background and contemplates the job at hand. (cc).

programme.title: Brainstorm
programme.desc: Jeffrey Hunter as an unbalanced scientist who falls for the boss's wife (Anne Francis), and feigns insanity in a plot to murder her sadistic husband (Dana Andrews). Dr. Larstadt: Viveca Lindfors. Reynolds: Josh Harris. Directed by actor William Conrad ("Cannon").

programme.title: King Richard and the Crusaders
programme.desc: Believing to be on a holy mission from God, King Richard the Lionheart leads the Third Crusade and battles the Saracenesand, led by the legendary Saladin, while simultaneously fighting push back from his own allies.

programme.title: Painting the Clouds with Sunshine
programme.desc: A song-and-dance vehicle about husband hunters in Las Vegas. Dennis Morgan, Virginia Mayo, Gene Nelson, Lucille Norman. David Butler directed.

programme.title: The West Point Story
programme.desc: A Broadway director heads to West Point to stage a show written by one of the cadets, who's the nephew of a theatrical impresario, but the director runs into problems mounting the production and becomes flustered with the academy's rules and regulations. The music score was nominated for an Oscar.

programme.title: She's Working Her Way Through College
programme.desc: Musical reworking of "The Male Animal" is about a burlesque queen who decides to give it the old college try and enrolls at a university, but meets with some resistance from the stuffy administration.

programme.title: The Big Land
programme.desc: A crooked cattle buyer has a beef with a Texas rancher who tries to convince Missouri farmers to establish a small town as a railroad link between the Rio Grande and Kansas City, thus seeing livestock prices increase.

programme.title: Great Day in the Morning
programme.desc: Conflict arises in Denver at the outbreak of the Civil War.

programme.title: Colorado Territory
programme.desc: A veteran outlaw who is freshly sprung from prison meets up with his old partners for one last train heist, falling for a dance-hall girl along the way in what would become a fateful robbery attempt for them both.

programme.title: Flaxy Martin
programme.desc: The old one about a man (Zachary Scott) led astray by an underworld temptress (Virginia Mayo). Dorothy Malone. Malko: Tom D'Andrea. Peggy: Helen Westcott. Richie: Douglas Kennedy. Roper: Elisha Cook Jr. Competently done. Directed by Richard Bare.(n)

programme.title: Backfire
programme.desc: An injured veteran tracks his Army buddy, who's fleeing a trumped up murder charge.(n)

programme.title: Smart Girls Don't Talk
programme.desc: A socialite (Virginia Mayo) becomes involved with gangsters who run a nitery. Bruce Bennett, Helen Westcott, Robert Hutton. Richard Bare directed.(n)

programme.title: The Girl From Jones Beach
programme.desc: Frolic about a curvaceous teacher (Virginia Mayo) pursued by a commercial artist (Ronald Reagan). Eddie Bracken, Dona Drake, Henry Travers. Mother: Lois Wilson. Miss Shoemaker: Florence Bates. Graves: Jerome Cowan. Woody: Gary Gray.(n)

programme.title: The Princess and the Pirate
programme.desc: Bob Hope plays a cowardly actor who runs afoul of buccaneers on the Spanish Main. (cc).(n)

programme.title: South Sea Woman
programme.desc: A marine faces a court martial for desertion after he and a fellow soldier endure many adventures while trying to make it from Shanghai to Pearl Harbor before the Japanese attack.(n)

programme.title: The Face Behind the Mask
programme.desc: An accident-scarred immigrant is briefly diverted from crime by the love of a blind girl.(n)

programme.title: Arsenic and Old Lace
programme.desc: Macabre comedy about a pair of sweet old ladies from Brooklyn who put lonely bachelors out of their misery with sips from their arsenic-laced elderberry wine---"acts of mercy" that their visiting nephew finds hard to swallow. The film is based on Joseph Kesselring's Broadway play, a long-running hit that contractually delayed release of the picture almost three years (cc).(n)

programme.title: Silk Stockings
programme.desc: Musical remake of the 1939 comedy "Ninotchka" features a tuneful Cole Porter soundtrack and tells the tale of a stern Russian emissary sent to Paris on business but discovering the pleasures of capitalism and romance with a movie producer.(n)

programme.title: You'll Find Out
programme.desc: Kay Kyser and his orchestra offer a melange of mirth, melody and mayhem in this spoof of "Old House" horror films. Janis: Helen Parrish. Fenninger: Peter Lorre. Mainwaring: Boris Karloff. Margo: Alma Kruger. Saliano: Bela Lugosi. Chuck: Dennis O'Keefe. Ginny Simms: Herself. Harry Babbitt: Himself. Jurgen: Joseph Eggenton. Sully Mason: Himself. Ish Kabibble: Himself. David Butler directed.(n)

programme.title: All Through the Night
programme.desc: Humphrey Bogart plays a New Yorker with underworld connections who battles Nazi saboteurs planning to sink a battleship. Conrad Veidt, Kaaren Verne, Peter Lorre, Jane Darwell, Judith Anderson, Frank McHugh, William Demarest, Barton MacLane, Jackie Gleason, Phil Silvers, Wally Ford. Directed by Vincent Sherman.(n)

programme.title: The Comedy of Terrors
programme.desc: A gathering of some of the genre's greats (Vincent Price, Boris Karloff, Peter Lorre, Basil Rathbone) in a spook-spoof involving the funeral business. Joe E. Brown, Joyce Jameson. Richard Matheson script.(n)

programme.title: Scent of Mystery
programme.desc: A vacationing photographer (Denholm Elliott) stumbles onto a murder plot and hustles through Spain to save the intended victim. Peter Lorre, Beverly Bentley, Paul Lukas. Johnny: Liam Redmond. Tommy: Leo McKern. Fleming: Peter Arne. Winifred: Diana Dors. Margharita: Mary Laura Wood. Also known as "Holiday in Spain." Jack Cardiff directed.(n)

programme.title: Animal Kingdom *
programme.desc: J realizes the danger of balancing his role in the family with his personal ambitions. Deran wants to take his relationship with Adrian to the next level, but it's not as easy as he hoped. (cc).

programme.title: Animal Kingdom
programme.desc: J realizes the danger of balancing his role in the family with his personal ambitions. Deran wants to take his relationship with Adrian to the next level, but it's not as easy as he hoped. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: A cop in hi-tech "pre-crime" unit in 2054 goes on the run after being labeled as a future killer. In order to prove his innocence, he kidnaps one of the psychics who predicts the imminent crimes while eluding a determined G-man. (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A radio personality (Jose Zuniga) is almost killed, but the police thinks that it may have been a publicity stunt. Jarret Whitestone: Joe Piscopo. Michael Ruffino: Arthur Nascarella. Fontana: Dennis Farina. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Fontana and Green investigate the shootings of four people on the street and learn that one victim was a philandering jeweler with Russian mob connections. Zina Rybakov: Mercedes Ruehl. Sydelle Greenblatt: Ilene Getz. Mark Edleburg: Todd Gearheart. Cranky Wife: Robin Morse. Cranky Husband: Gud Rogerson. Fontana: Dennis Farina. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A police-department cover-up stymies the prosecution of a 30-year-old murder case involving a college protester and a security guard (Michael Higgins). Kushner: Roy Thinnes. Walder: Robert Hogan. Latham: Cynthia Hayden. McCoy: Sam Waterston. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.(n)

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.(n)

programme.desc: Visiting Dr Ranj at the Children's hospital today is Petal. Petal needs the cast on her arm changing because it has got dirty and is crumbling. Petal has a fractured arm. Petal thinks her arm is thin and smelly but this is because she hasn't been able to wash it. Dr Ranj says Petal can choose the colour of her new cast. Petal picks her favourite colour, purple.
